body_content.explanation:
past simple and past participle of 
stream
to flow somewhere or produce liquid, quickly and in large amounts without stopping:
examples: There were tears streaming down his face.
One woman was carried from the scene of the accident with blood streaming from her head.
I've got a terrible cold and my nose has been streaming all week.

body_content.explanation: to move continuously in one direction:
examples: We were all very excited as we streamed out of our final exam.
Officials estimate that 20,000 refugees streamed into the city last week.
His hair streamed out behind him as he rode off.

body_content.explanation: to send or receive sound or video directly over the internet as a continuous flow:
examples: On YouTube, millions of videos are streamed every day.
To pick up this signal, you will need a high-speed internet connection to stream it to your computer.

body_content.explanation: to group and teach together school students with similar abilities who are approximately the same age:
examples: We start to stream the children in the third form.
